reviewDescription: I have been using Printshop software since the olden days. (12 years or more?) It is a one time fee and you own it software so you don't have to pay every month thank god. Over the years I have had challenges when I first install it which are usually overcome if I persist, try and try again. The last time I installed I just left the PC on overnight and somehow it resolved the installation problem while I was sleeping. Anyway once you get it installed it is worth it to persist in learning any new updates. I have seen too many reviews where the reviewer claims they couldn't do something and it seems to me they just didn't want to learn a newer or updated way. I am really hooked on this software. I make greeting cards, paint party kits see photo all printed materials were made with printshop professional 5, marketing materials, and lots more. The "my projects" section becomes a gallery of all my photographed art works which I print out to include in craft shows application. Christmas letters and greeting cards are fun to make with this software. I tried the other really big name pricey software and was bled dry and overwhelmed by it. This software is simple and more intuitive once you get the hang of it.
reviewTitle: I've been using the affordable Printshop softwares for years and years.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023

reviewDescription: It downloaded fine, but I do not like its new style.  It's harder to find images I want, and it seems that there are a lot of new images that I consider ugly or stupid.  The older version is much more user-friendly and logical.  I've used Print Shop for years, and I am very disappointed in this particular version.UPDATE!Now that I've had a chance to really get into this newer version of Print Shop, I can honestly say that I HATE IT!  I find it cumbersome, inconvenient, and slow.  Searching for an image takes an inordinate amount of time because first, you have to enter two filters (which I had to figure out how to do by myself).  Then, after your chosen category and sub-category finally load, you scroll through the pages of images.  Each page takes almost a minute to load.  Then, when you select an image, it takes more time to load.  Then, when you return to your filtered images, you end up right back on the first page, where you had started so long ago!  So, if you had progressed through to, say, page 7, now you have to "thumb" your way back from page 1 to where you had left off.And, let's talk about the images.  Most are ugly, in my opinion.  What happened to the nice images I used to use with my previous versions of Print Shop?  Maybe I just can't find them among all the new, stupid-looking cartoons.  All I know is that I usually cannot find what I want now.So, I was working on a project, and I wanted to do some editing of an image.  I simply wanted to change the color of the lines.  No can do!  At least, I couldn't figure out how to achieve this small task in the hour I spent trying.  Then, I wanted to add some color to some cells on a calendar page.  I was able to achieve that, however, at one point, the program just stopped letting me access the editing feature.  Just stopped.  I couldn't do anything more to my calendar page.Now, I have a brand new HP Pavilion computer with Windows 10.  It is a fantastic computer...lots more storage capacity than any other computer I have used at home and at work.  And it's FAST!  I also have Xfinity High Speed Wireless service.  So, I know the issues I'm having with this version of Print Shop have nothing to do with my computer or Internet service!BOTTOM LINE!  Since returns are not allowed, I will be looking for a different program to meet my desktop publishing needs.  I am done with Print Shop!  Any ideas out there?  I would love to know what other programs folks are using and really like!
reviewTitle: I don't like it. AT. ALL.

reviewDescription: I have always had a mac and have been using Broaderbund's Printmaster products for many years to create simple invitations, cards, flyers for work, etc.  Nothing too fancy, and typically an easy program to work with if you're not a graphic designer and don't want to spend a lot of money.While their early products, originally discs, compatible with both PC's and Macs, were quirky at times on macs, they did the job.As computers and programming have become more complicated, current PrintMaster products, are increasingly less compatible nor stable on today's Macs.  Yes, even the v7 - which I purchased from this outside seller and have kept - works "good enough" - but certain features can't be opened.  (I had hoped to upgrade to the v8, prior to settling for the v7, which I'd purchased directly from Broaderbund and had to return. Total mess!). The Broaderbund customer service folks were kind enough to refund and I know their programmers are working on the Mac compatibility issues.  Not there as of this writing, I'm afraid.

reviewDescription: Well this is my third PrintMaster I've owned. My last one was PrintMaster 18.1 and I will tell you this - the programmer's have made a huge step backward. Although the interface is changed the functionality is greatly diminished. The old version had so many extra's with the creations you make from scratch that it was unbelievable. This version has so many issues: No more drag and drop or copy and paste pictures, very limited shapes for texts, incredibly cumbersome with just about every function you use. If the the companies idea was to streamline the program they missed the boat entirely. I believe what they were trying to do was create a program where it was simpler to just make a card or letterhead from a template and even that is twice as difficult. I've been using PrintMaster for at least 20 years and I will tell that for $40 bucks I guess it will do the job if you have the time and patience to click here, drag there etc., etc. and that's my 2 cents worth.

reviewDescription: I bought the Master's Edition of this software directly from their website several years ago. Little did I know at the time that I would only get free software updates for 6 months following my purchase, before I was either required to spend more money, or eventually be left out to dry. Since I'm not made of money, I've been using my outdated version of VideoPad for just over 3 years now, with newer bug and performance fixes stuck behind an additional paywall. Was it worth the $70 price tag?I've never regretted spending money on professional software more.On my old computer, which had 16GB of RAM, VideoPad was incredibly sluggish, and notoriously unreliable. I've been creating 2 identical save files for all of my projects that I would alternate between, because VideoPad would spontaneously crash multiple times a day, and flip a coin on whether or not it would corrupt my whole file when I reopened it, costing me hours of work. Boy, I hoped they fixed that in a future update that I'd have to pay to access! -__-My new PC that I just got last month has 32GB of RAM and VideoPad performs much better. Well, at least the demo version does, because now I can't get my old license to register at all, despite the fact that I was told it was for life.Every instance of attempting to use this product over the years has been a headache-inducing chore.If you were guaranteed permanent access to the software I'd say go for it, IF you have enough RAM and CPU to handle it, which I know many don't, but considering your purchase only stays current for half a year before NCH forgets you exist, I can definitively tell everyone here, regardless of their hardware, to GET SOMETHING ELSE. VideoPad is absolutely a bullet worth dodging.
reviewTitle: I came here to warn you - VideoPad is a bullet worth dodging
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2022

reviewDescription: I was hopeful. After reading the reviews on all the other brands of print programs, I finally settled for the Print Artist 25 Platinum download—even though the reviews weren’t terrific. But then the reviews weren’t great on ANY of the different programs other than the more professional products. I had used several different versions of PrintShop over many years and LOVED it until I finally got a new computer with Windows 10 and my PrintShop 15 was not compatible with that. I resisted buying a new program for several years because a.) the reviews on the newer versions were dismal and b.) I couldn’t bring myself to learn something new that I was sure would not be as good. Finally I knew I couldn’t trust my old computer any more and I was going to have to get something else or risk losing everything. So I broke down and bought Print Artist 25 Platinum.First with the good things:  I had no problem with the download (thanks in part to my husband). I was nervous about that due to some reviews I had read. Secondly, there are a few newer features that my ancient PrintShop didn’t have, due I am sure, to newer technology.So far, that is where the good things end. It’s been pretty frustrating trying to work with this program. I know there is a learning curve and as I work with it more, I will become more proficient with it. However it is very obvious that the program is very bulky and difficult to circumnavigate. What took two or three simple steps in my old program would take ten in this new one. The project I was working on tonight would have taken me less than an hour previously.  Tonight it took me more than five hours. I am not a novice at home publishing. I have done many hundreds of projects over many years. I know if I keep working at it, it will get easier and faster. But I feel sorry for people who are just getting started in this kind of program. And to tell the truth, I am discouraged enough to go ahead and spend the extra money and go back to PrintShop despite their reviews. At least I am familiar with it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023

reviewDescription: To post this software as free is misleading. To make anyone create a video with it only to discover they cannot export and save their work on their computer or share to the internet - except they pay for a licensed version - is not inappropriate but annoying!After downloading it on amazon thinking it was free, I went on to create a video. However, when I wanted to export my video, a message popped up prompting me to pay for the licensed copy in order to export my video. I ignored the message and continued to export. The exported video came out blocked, and I could not see anything!I was compelled to pay for a 3 months subscription in order not waste the efforts I put into creating that video. Still, after getting the licensed version, I only exported one video. My subsequent efforts to export another video I created are giving me blocked content in the output like I got when I had not paid for the supposedly free version.Amazon should either take down this post, or inform their customers that this is only a trial version. I hate marketing by gimmicks!

reviewDescription: I was devastated that windows movie maker is not available anymore. I bought several other editing programs (cyber link, sony vegas movie studio, filmora, and a couple others, they were all nearly impossible to learn as quickly as I was anticipating... Even after watching youtube videos which offers tips and tricks and teaches you the ins and outs I was still struggling to feel comfortable and confident using these very expensive softwares. Finally I found video pad and I fell in love, it has much more to offer than windows movie maker and I can navigate through the program quickly and easily. YES you still have to take the time out to learn it! Nothing out there is as easy as WMM but this is as straight forward and easy to learn as its going to get in my own opinion. It could also just be that I am/ was overwhelmed and didn't have the length of time it would take to learn other programs but either way I am in LOVE with videopad! Thanks videopad for not making it a complicated headache just to edit some family vlog footage lol :)

reviewDescription: I read the reviews -- which were pretty mediocre to begin with -- and saw others complain that this FREE program is not free.  I also saw the manufacturer's response saying that this was a mistake.  WELL....it's just happened to me!  I downloaded a short video from my phone and needed to shorten it and the program says I need to upgrade in order to save it and send it out.  They're giving me a "reduced" price if I upgrade now.  From $99 down to $69 for their full version.  Then from $60 down to $39 for their less-robust version.  I went to my local computer store this afternoon and they looked it up.Interestingly, when they went to the NCH website, they were offered the lower version for $29!!  What a stinkin' thing to do!  I now need to download another file and send it off TONIGHT --- and have to pay them $39 for the privilege!!!  I don't need anything fancy.  I just need to get videos off my phone and then tweak slightly -- shorten them up, for instance -- before sending them off to others who need it.  NOT happy!

reviewDescription: no documentation.  "Users Guide" is nothing but a list of the software they have for sale.  The videos are useless.This is not the Print Shop i've been using since 2013.Besides being completely non-intuitive, the print quality is awful: blurry, fuzzy.A complete waste of money & time.How did a great program transform into garbage.
reviewTitle: Awful. impossible to use.  Low quality print
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2023

reviewDescription: Downloads fine, installs, but once you create something you can’t print. A dialogue box keeps asking for a key the the one supplied doesn’t work. Support keeps telling me to do the same thing over and over, which is a waste of time!!! Really wasted my $$ and time on this. AND since I didn’t purchase through the company, they don’t do refunds!! And I don’t see that as an option here on Amazon.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023

reviewDescription: Glad to see this product can finally support current Mac OS.  Comes with tons of clip arts and ready made templates.  Future updates with support for vector image will be nice!
reviewTitle: Finally can use on Mac Big Sur and Catalina OS
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021

reviewDescription: I purchased this after using PSD on my Mac for years.  My OS stopped supporting the older version.  This is NOT the same program!  Encore (who previously licensed the name to the previous developer  I was told by the lady at the 800 #) doesn't even offer any kind of support except by email.  The help function is a joke and a forum page page their website refers you to does not exist.  The clip art and templates are abysmal and I cannot figure out how to resize photo or text.  A complete and utter waste of money.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2023

reviewDescription: Lousy graphics. Hard to use. Nothing like the original. Wasted my money on this.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023

reviewDescription: I had Printmaster on my PC but have changed to a MAC. This PrintShop program is NOT user friendly, You cannot write text without having to rewrite over and over. This program DOES NOT WORK! And I can't return it.I wish I had paid more attention to the reviews.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2024

reviewDescription: I had no problem downloading the program. I was worried since I have a new Mac that runs Ventura but it works fine on it.It is definitely not as user friendly as the old version but I think it will be easy enough to figure out. I think the images on the old version were better too.It will work fine for what I use it for.
reviewTitle: Not like the original Print Shop
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022

reviewDescription: The latest version of The Print Shop is way too difficult. The tutorials are okay but more details would be better. I used an older version for years and it was a lot easier even though it wasn’t that versatile. I’m not done learning it but so far it’s just okay. I’m sure someone who is more experienced than I am would have a lot more good things to say.
